data.title: Provost Surname Origin, Meaning & Last Name History
data.meta_description: Learn the fascinating origin of the Provost surname; its meaning & distribution. Unlock your family history in the largest database of last names.
data.text:
Where Does The Last Name Provost Come From? nationality or country of origin

Provost (Russian: Провост) is found in France more than any other country/territory. It can also be found as a variant:. For other potential spellings of this last name click here.

How Common Is The Last Name Provost? popularity and diffusion

The last name Provost is the 16,716th most numerous family name worldwide, borne by approximately 1 in 219,405 people. Provost occurs mostly in The Americas, where 58 percent of Provost live; 58 percent live in North America and 37 percent live in Anglo-North America. Provost is also the 1,321,957th most commonly held first name at a global level It is held by 56 people.

The last name Provost is most widespread in France, where it is carried by 11,486 people, or 1 in 5,783. In France it is mostly found in: Pays de la Loire, where 22 percent are found, Île-de-France, where 16 percent are found and Brittany, where 15 percent are found. Aside from France Provost occurs in 70 countries. It is also found in The United States, where 34 percent are found and Canada, where 26 percent are found.

Provost Family Population Trend historical fluctuation

The prevalency of Provost has changed through the years. In The United States the number of people carrying the Provost surname increased 817 percent between 1880 and 2014; in England it increased 193 percent between 1881 and 2014 and in Scotland it increased 400 percent between 1881 and 2014.

Provost Last Name Statistics demography

In The United States those bearing the Provost surname are 0.54000000000001% more likely to be registered Democrats than The US average, with 53.77% registered with the political party.

The amount Provost earn in different countries varies somewhat. In United States they earn 3.52% more than the national average, earning $44,668 USD per year and in Canada they earn 10.53% less than the national average, earning $44,452 CAD per year.
